$interpreted: Naya: How strange...Atlas feels warmer than last time we were here...
Naya: Or is it just me?
Angelia: ... Hmmm...

Angelia: It's not just you. This place is indeed warmer.
I wonder why...
Sherlock: ...So what? This is nothing to be surprised about.
Naya: What?
Sherlock: Before the giant explosion, Atlas was always a warm and hospitable place.
Sherlock: If not for that natural advantage, Atlas wouldn't have turned into a prosperous trade post in the first place.
Angelia: ...Now that you mentioned it, that does make sense...
Angelia: I wonder who's behind all these changes to Atlas...
Sherlock: This climate improvement won't help much though! Atlas is already a lost cause!

Sherlock: ...The Dragoneye Gem did plug up the void, certainly; and because of that, monsters no longer come out of the void anymore.
However, the ones that were already out still roam the land.
Elio: He has a point. There seems to still be plenty of monsters wandering around...
Naya: So mechanicians are afraid of monsters as well?
Sherlock: I simply don't like places where I can't make money. These monsters and marionettes aren't going to buy anything from me...

Sherlock: Ah, but if one can make money selling human bones, that's a different story all together~
There's definitely no shortage of that around here, since the explosion left behind plenty of dead bodies~
Angelia: Sir Sherlock, the Atlas explosion was a horrible tragedy that left many people in grief.

Angelia: At least, for the sake of those who perished, 
please don't talk about that incident in such a nonchalant manner.
Sherlock: Oh, you wanna play the good guy now? Did you forget that it was YOUR grandfather who bought the Dragoneye Gem and took it away from Atlas?

Sherlock: The void, the monsters, the deadly explosion;
If we were to place blame for all that, the Carlos family would be real high on that list!
Naya: You damn Tin Can...do you want me to send your gears flying again?

Sherlock: What, I only agreed to come with you folks. Me keeping my mouth shut wasn't part of the deal. 
If you don't like it, cancel the deal and let me go!
Angelia: Naya, stop arguing...
Naya: Don't stop me! What this guy needs now is a solid spanking!
Elio: That's not the issue. You guys are too loud!
Naya: Hmph, coming back for more!?
Elio: If this keeps up, we will be overrun in no time...
Naya: Dammit...don't even have time to catch a breath...
Sherlock: Hey, do something!

Angelia: Too many monsters, we can't take them head-on.
Everyone, preserve your stamina as much as possible. Fall back.
Sherlock: T-There are monsters here as well!
Naya: Crap, we're surrounded...
Sherlock: Great, now I'm going to die in this ****hole of a place thanks to you folks...
Angelia: ... Is this where it all ends...
Nigel: What is a kingdom noble doing here?
Angelia: ...... Nigel!
Naya: So you're here! And who are these people? Your subordinates?
Nigel: No time to explain now! Come with me if you want to live!
